segments.text: Looking at this kitchen, I notice the open cabinets and the cookie jar full of treats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretched out on that unstable stool, grabbing cookies like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me nervous just watching him; he could fall and hurt himself badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, egging him on with her hand raised expectantly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the woman at the sink is oblivious, polishing her plate diligently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is gushing from the faucet, flooding the basin and spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and it's right under her feet—she might slip any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes are stacked neatly on the counter, waiting to be put away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The curtains are tied back, letting in that bright daylight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden is so tidy with bushes and a path—such a contrast to this chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: These kids are going to get in trouble if the woman turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's all so precarious, hanging on the edge of disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
